snippet.title: Social media users migrating to smaller circles
snippet.description:
* In an age when people are encouraged to collect hundreds of Facebook "friends" and thousands of Twitter followers, some social media users, particularly young ones, are going smaller.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/25/tech/social-media/smaller-social-networks/index.html

snippet.title: Michael Porter on GPS: Is the U.S. #1?
snippet.description:
* CNN’s FAREED ZAKARIA GPS features an interview with professor at the Harvard Business School, and Director at the Institute for Strategy and Competitiveness, Michael Porter. Porter spoke about “The Social Progress Index”, a new report that ranks...
http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/20/michael-porter-on-gps-is-the-u-s-1/

snippet.title: How phones work in flight
snippet.description:
* The lack of phone calls, texts or social media postings from missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has raised a number of questions about how cell phones work on airplanes. A U.S. official told CNN a cell tower in Penang, Malaysia, detected the co-pilot's cell phone searching for service before t...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/14/tech/mobile/phones-in-flight/index.html

snippet.title: TV scorecard: Will your favorite show return?
Lytro refocuses with a new $1,600 camera
snippet.description:
* Lytro is trying to make interactive pictures happen, again.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/22/tech/innovation/lytro-illum-camera/index.html

snippet.title: More than 10 million core users give value to Weibo ahead of lPO
snippet.description:
* As Weibo, the largest social media platform in China, gets ready for its initial public offering (IPO), a recent university study claims Chinese micro-blogging activity might not be as vibrant as expected.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/10/business/china-weibo-user-base/index.html

snippet.title: No longer just a factory, China is a mobile leader
snippet.description:
* With over 700 million active smartphone users, China's mobile market is insane in scale. But sheer numbers aside, what makes it really impressive?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/22/world/asia/china-mobile-innovation/index.html

snippet.title: CNN Digital Posts Strongest Month Ever in March 2014
snippet.description:
* Closes Gap with Yahoo!-ABC News to Only 1% Video and Mobile Consumption Shatters Records Building off a busy news cycle, March 2014 marked the strongest month in history for CNN Digital Network. Users flocked to CNN for its extensive coverage of the...
http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/23/cnn-digital-posts-strongest-month-ever-in-march-2014/

snippet.title: Politicians slug it out in India's first social media election
snippet.description:
* Earlier this month during Holi, the Indian festival of colors, more than three million Twitter followers of the Indian prime ministerial candidate Narendra Modi received a personalized greeting from him. Others received celebratory recorded phone messages that concluded with an appeal to vote.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/09/world/asia/indias-first-social-media-election/index.html

snippet.title: World Health Day: The neglected diseases that plague 1 in 6
snippet.description:
* There's a popular African proverb that seems particularly relevant to this World Health Day: "If you think you're too small to make a difference, try sleeping in a closed room with a mosquito." Beyond their power to annoy, mosquitoes and other insects carry an outsized ability to kill, disable and disfigure people in massive num...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/07/opinion/world-health-day-beating-diseases/index.html
